node.title: A New Publishing Platform for Comic Books Will Give Creators a Greater Stake
node.alt: “The Awakened” is a superhero murder mystery written by Alex Segura and Michael Moreci, with art by Dean Kotz and colors by Jason Wordie.
node.description: Zestworld, which counts Alexis Ohanian as a supporter, will allow comic book writers and artists to present new work and reap the benefits.
node.content: ["Many comic book characters anchor global franchises, but their creators \u2014 or the writers and artists who helped make them popular \u2014 have not always shared in that success. Zestworld, a new subscription-based platform that is set to be introduced in early 2022, is hoping to change that.", "Zestworld will allow comic book writers and artists to present new work and reap the benefits \u2014 and help monetize their creations if they are made into collectibles or adapted for TV, movies or other media. The creators will be stockholders in the company. ", "\u201cIn setting out to build this, we started with the problem statement that this industry is broken for creators; and it\u2019s broken in publishing and TV and film; it\u2019s also broken in events and collectibles,\u201d Chris Giliberti, the founder and chief executive officer of Zestworld, said during a recent telephone interview. \u201cWe wanted to build something that\u2019s useful across all areas of their business \u2014 anywhere they generate income.\u201d", "One investor in Zestworld is the venture capitalist firm Seven Seven Six, which was founded by Alexis Ohanian, the co-founder of Reddit. \u201cI\u2019m a lifelong comics fan, so much so that I didn\u2019t read an actual book for pleasure until college,\u201d he said in an email interview. \u201cThis investment started from a place of personal passion, but it\u2019s also a perfect fit with my investing history in the creator economy.\u201d Ohanian was one of the first investors in Patreon, a platform founded in 2013 where people can pay musicians, podcasters, comic book artists and others for access to premium content.", "Zestworld\u2019s initial roster of comic book creators includes Eric Canete, Amanda Conner, Phil Jimenez, Jimmy Palmiotti, Alex Segura and Peter Tomasi, all of whom have been given advances to develop original stories for the platform. \u201cThe Awakened,\u201d for example, is a superhero murder mystery told by Segura, who is writing it with Michael Moreci, with art by Dean Kotz.", "Palmiotti and Conner, who worked on several Harley Quinn comics for DC Comics, are working on a couple of projects for Zestworld, including a story about Booty Powpow, an immortal woman from ancient times who wakes up in the present day. Palmiotti is also writing \u201cFound,\u201d with art by Juan Santacruz, about the discovery of a spaceship on Earth.", "From the early days of comics, characters were typically owned by and benefited the publishers, not the creative team who dreamed them up. (Famously, for example, Superman\u2019s creators sold their rights to the character for $130.)", "Palmiotti said he and Conner were excited about Zestworld\u2019s offer. \u201cThey put their money where their mouth was,\u201d he said during a recent telephone interview. \u201cThey came to us and said, \u2018You guys can do whatever you want. We want you to create some comics and characters. You guys own them, you guys control them.\u2019\u201d", "With Zestworld, he said, \u201cNothing\u2019s being done without sitting with us and talking to us and nothing is being made without it benefiting us. It\u2019s the kind of transparency all creators need.\u201d"]
